result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84
9:05 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Indicates there will be uncharged read-ins as well. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF247 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF12 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF47 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF48 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty to the following:
14CF247 Count 1 
15CF12 Counts 1 & 2 
15CF47 Counts 1 & 2
15CF48 Count 1 
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

14CF452 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF12 Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF48 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF84 is dismissed and read-in. 
Uncharged read-in to be provided to defense in writing.  That is to be done before the sentencing. 


Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 12/11/2015 with copies forwarded to counsel so they can prepare for sentencing. 
Court orders that all bonds are revoked.

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84

Atty Molepske makes statements.  Defendant will not be entering a plea. 
Atty Halverson indicates the defendant has some questions. 

2:07 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond & Conditions of Bond are continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William J Scott
Current: 119 W North St, Plainfield, WI 54966-9289 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2015)
Prior: 7771 County Road A, Almond, WI 54909

$15,000 cash bond to cover all files 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.   If posts bond, also maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:35 p.m. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant William J Scott appeared by video. Cases # 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.  Warrants quashed.
Court questions reasons for not appearing prior for court.  DA requests $25,000 cash bond.

BTC: $15,000 cash bond to cover all files 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.   If posts bond, also maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

/s/ TTF 6/6/15 
cc: DA w/ minutes 6/8/15 ks

Defendant did not appear. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:20 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court reviews the file.  Received the Day Report assessment.  
Atty Renc did not expect her client here today. 
Atty Molepske requests bench warrants. 

BY THE COURT:  Bench warrants on all files.  Body Only.  Any bonds that have been posted in the files, are ordered forfeited.  

Atty Molepske makes statements re: Geographic restriction.  
Court agrees, because they are felony matters, they should not be limited to the State of Wisconsin in case he is picked up in another state.
Status conference on March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Anne Renc. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
T. Porfilio-Pelot is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Molepske. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff.  
Atty Molepske moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. 
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit #1 is received. 

Cross exam by Atty Renc. 

BY THE COURT:    Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Atty Renc indicates the information does not mirror the complaint. 
Atty Molepske asks for permission to amend the information to include all dates listed in the complaint. 
Atty Renc does not object to the amendment being done on the record.  
Court adds the dates to the information filed. 
Defendant received copy of the information and as amended, would waive the reading of the information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Post $200 before the end of the business day on Friday November 21, 2014.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $200 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  12/01/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Court informs the defendant to contact the Public Defender re: appointing Atty Renc.
